Package com.atakmap.android.bluetooth

Class BluetoothManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.atakmap.android.bluetooth.BluetoothManager
  • public class BluetoothManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages the Bluetooth Laser Range Finder (LRF) connections. This class assumes Bluetooth is already enabled on the device.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static interface  BluetoothManager.BluetoothConnectionListener  
      static interface  BluetoothManager.BluetoothReaderFactory
      This interface allows for external BluetoothReaders to be registered by a plugin.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static BluetoothManager getInstance()

      • addExternalBluetoothReader

        public void addExternalBluetoothReader​(BluetoothManager.BluetoothReaderFactory brf)
        Allows for plugins to create a reader for a specific bluetooth device. This will allow for a plugin to override the current bluetooth behavior.
        Parameters:
        brf - the bluetooth reader factory.

      • removeExternalBluetoothReader

        public void removeExternalBluetoothReader​(BluetoothManager.BluetoothReaderFactory brf)
        Removes a previously registered bluetooth reader factory.
        Parameters:
        brf - the bluetooth reader factory to remove.

      • getAllDevices

        public java.util.List<android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice> getAllDevices()
        Lists all Bluetooth devices currently known by the bluetooth manager. This includes both classic bluetooth devices and bt low energy devices.
        Returns:
        a list of BluetoothDevice's known by the bluetooth manager.

      • getConnections

        public java.util.List<android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice> getConnections()
        Lists all Bluetooth devices currently connected through the bluetooth manager. This includes both classic bluetooth devices and bt low energy devices.
        Returns:
        a list of BluetoothDevice's currently considered connected.

      • addConnectionListener

        public void addConnectionListener​(BluetoothManager.BluetoothConnectionListener bcl)
        Adds a connection listener for classic bluetooth devices.
        Parameters:
        bcl - the connection listener

      • removeConnectionListener

        public void removeConnectionListener​(BluetoothManager.BluetoothConnectionListener bcl)
        Remove a connection listener for classic bluetooth devices.
        Parameters:
        bcl - the connection listener

      • disableForATSK

        @Deprecated
@DeprecatedApi(since="4.1")
public void disableForATSK()
        Deprecated.
        In order for the legacy ATSK to work, we need to programmatically disable internal support for the R10 and R8 RTK units. This will be removed if ATSK is retired.

      • getContext

        public android.content.Context getContext()

      • setContext

        public void setContext​(android.content.Context context)

      • interrupt

        public void interrupt()
        Sets the interrupt flag which can be used by other methods within the Bluetooth Manager. Most notably will allow the start() mechanism to break out early.

      • start

        public void start()
        Start the scanning process. Once scanning has begun, it will go through a period of Bluetooth Low Energy Scanning followed by a period of classic bluetooth scanning. At any point along the way, if interrupt is called, it will only interrupt the next stage of scanning. If interrupt is processed, the user still will need to call stop before starting again.

      • stop

        public void stop()

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
